bias: a tendency to believe that some people, ideas, etc, are better than others.
discrimination: unfairly treating a person or group of people differently from other groups of people.
favoritism: unfairly treating some people better than others.
judgement: the ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions.
stereotype: a widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of person or thing.
prejudice: preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience; dislike, hostility, or unjust behavior deriving from unfounded opinions
detain: keep (someone) in official custody, typically for questioning about a crime or in politically sensitive situations
adapt: to make fit (as for a new use) by modification. ***** the curriculum to students needs
